intro: Taraxacum subcrispum, commonly known as the curlyleaf dandelion, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its basal rosette of dark green, hairy, and slightly curled leaves. The plant produces a yellow flower head that develops into a white, fluffy seed head known as a pappus. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and gardens. Botanically, it belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
